text:
Ant 1.7 provided an updated COPY task that allows passing in resource collections, rather than exclusively filesets. This change hasn't made it to SCP.

The situation I'm in right now is that I need to code an Ant macro that uses COPY or SCP depending on the target files' location. My resource collection may be a "SORT" collection. That works wonderfully for COPY, fails for SCP. SCP wouldn't even accept a SORT-wrapped fileset:

<sort id="mycollection">
   <fileset dir="some-directory"/>
</sort>
.
.
.
<scp>
   <resources refid="mycollection"/>
</scp>

(Claiming that "mycollection" is not a fileset reference)
creator: isaac@shabtay.com
rednoah@users.sourceforge.net
text: I'd like a fix for this issue as well. Not being able to use <sort> and Resource Collections in general for <scp> tasks is really annoying, and can probably be fixed easily.
I don't think anybody is actively working on this enhancement request, so you won't be tripping on any toes.  Patches are very welcome, thanks!
